flawed_nl_solution:
If 40 pounds of food was donated to the food bank in the first week, the second week, which had twice the amount of food donated as the first week, had 2*40 = 80 pounds of food.
The total amount of food donated to the food bank after the second week is 40+80 = <<40+80=120>>120 pounds.
In the third week, she gave to the homeless 70/100*120 = <<70/100*120=1200/7>>1200/7 pounds of food.
The total amount of food remaining in the food bank after she gave out 70% to the homeless is 120-1200/7 = <<120-1200/7=-360/7>>-360/7 pounds of food.
#### -360/7

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 84, not 1200/7. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
